text:
See references to busy_timeout in fcgid_bridge.c (request thread) and fcgid_pm_main.c (daemon) for the implementation of BusyTimeout processing.

Currently, the two threads need to agree on whether or not the app will be timed out, or both may release the corresponding procnode structure.  A fudge factor (10 seconds) is added to the BusyTimeout setting in the daemon when checking for a timeout, presumably to reduce the likelihood that the timeout is processed (i.e., the daemon releases the procnode structure) but the request thread doesn't think so (i.e., the request thread also releases the procnode structure).

Note that this implementation also requires the busy_timeout value to be propagated from the main server conf to the virtual host conf in fcgid_conf.c.  Hopefully that propagation can be removed when this is resolved.
creator: trawick@apache.org

text:
Regarding the comment "this implementation also requires the busy_timeout value to be propagated from the main server conf to the virtual host conf in fcgid_conf.c":

That was true at one time -- when FcgidBusyTimeout couldn't be set inside a vhost.  Once that restriction was removed, there was no unnatural propagation of the busy_timeout value.
